captions.text:
The Daily Struggles of
People Who Hate Mornings
- Hey girl, I was just going to ask you...
You, ah, I'm going to give you a minute.
Girl, aren't you going to eat breakfast?
- It's the most important meal of the day.
Such a beautiful day out today.
I always say, early bird gets the worm.
- Oh, I had the best workout this morning.
- Yeah, so 2015's looking a little weak,
and we're going to need some new ideas.
- Hey Madeleine, are you mad at me?
- Is it because I took your sweater?
- Oh good. Sorry about that, by the way.

- Oh my god, did you see
that sunrise this morning?

I mean, sunsets are beautiful,
like, that's where it's at.

I only see sunrises if I'm
hungover or I have to pee.

- Oh hey, do you want to
go hiking tomorrow morning?
You know, before it gets hot.
- You know, I'm going to raincheck.
It's Saturday morning, so, you know.
For Videos that are Totally You
- Hey, do you want to go clubbing?

title: Things People Who Hate Mornings Experience Every Day

comments.text:
0:16 That's pretty much my phone
1000 "Wakey Wakey!'
1030 "Time to wake up!"
1100 "Seriously, dude?!"
1130 "Wake up dummy!!"
1200 "Wake up Motherfucka!!"
1230 "Seriously, wake the fuck up!!"
Then I have my iPod with alarms in between those, and I have my actual 
alarm clock that is set at 0930. I have a problem, I know...﻿

I wake up and I am a zombie, I don't know what's going on because I 
pressed the snoozed button like 10 times and once I see that I'll be late 
if I don't get up I jump out of bed and frantically running all over the 
house getting ready and then when I am at school my friends all say they 
got at 530 in the morning while I just sit there trying to process the fact 
that they can even wake up that early and not be tired﻿

So I've tried the alarm "trick" where you set your phone or alarm clock 
across the room to make you get up to turn it off in the morning. I'm not 
sure about anyone else, but I *always* get up to go turn it off, turn back 
around, and go straight back to sleep.
I will do anything to avoid mornings.﻿
